subject: Career
title: Building a Transition Safety Net
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Building a Transition Safety Net.

hook.text: She didn't quit on Monday. She spent six months building savings, skills, and connections first.

buildup.text: Career transitions fail when people leap without preparation. A safety net makes bold moves possible.

discovery.text: The safety net has three layers: financial runway, skill foundation, and network in the target field.

twist.text: Most people overestimate the risk of transitioning and underestimate the risk of staying.

climax.text: Build before you leap: save six months of expenses, develop portable skills, and cultivate new allies.

punchline.text: Bold moves require quiet preparation. Build the net, then jump.

quiz.question: What are the three layers of a career transition safety net?
options: Financial runway, skill foundation, and target-field network
